posts.post_content:
Good for EDH.
  
   
Also, you can target yourself, so if you're really in a bind, you can sacrifice some high power creature of yours, or one that you stole, to draw a bunch of cards.

Posted By: pensaint (12/15/2009 6:55:16 AM)
Rating:

@Guest513736147: the Jacob Van Lunen's story is my favourite of all times!

This card costs like a hell, but with a severe control in the previous turns it's just an epic win! The fact that it costs so much means that it won't be overused like the others "Target player sacrifices a creature." cards, but it's in the late game that there are the biggest creature. You have to have other means to control the boards in the early game, but if you do everything right, at the end this is a powerhouse! Removal+draw isn't so common; removal+mass draw is almost unseen! (Ok, Decree of Pain is mass removal + mass draw, but it's the only one, I think... Edit: Even better: Overwhelming Forces...)

4.5/5
Report Abuse

posts.post_content:
Ahahaha, I miss using this card. It's been a while, but it was fun with [Nightscape Familiar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightscape Familiar)s in a casual red/blue/black deck I made... The card is costed well, but you have to aim it properly for it to be worth that cost.  
The art is hilarious. Dude is on the stand, and they have a noose ready... does the floor kick out or does a drake fly up holding the rope? lol
